intro: Spermacoce bangweolensis, commonly known as the Bangweol starling bean, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, black seeds. The species is characterized by its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves.
